channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.description:
Report E-2024070027

item.title: Report X-2024070147
item.description:
Report X-2024070147

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SUPERVISOR CALLED IN A LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND DECSION TREE TO THE SPILL. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAEKR. RESPONDER CONSULTED THE DECSION TREE ON HOW TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECSION TREE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER TO DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2024070112
item.description:
Report X-2024070112

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-18
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE RESPONDER RESPONDED TO DOOR 274 FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE. NO MARKING ON THE BOX THAT WOULD SUGGEST IT HAD A LIMITED QUANTITY MATERIAL INSIDE. THE PACKAGE WAS CONTAINERIZED AND BROUGHT TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. HELP DESK CALLED. PACKAGE BEING HELD FOR INSPECTION.

item.title: Report X-2024061233
item.description:
Report X-2024061233

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE LOAD WITH FULL PPE ON. USING THE DECISION TREE THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE LEAKER AND PLACED ALL MATERIAL IN A LINED SPILL TUB. THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE MATERIAL TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER NOTED THAT ONE 5 GALLON METAL BUCKET WAS DENTED AND LEAKING FROM THE SEAL. ALL MATERIAL WAS DISPOSED OF THROUGH DMP

item.title: Report X-2024061749
item.description:
Report X-2024061749

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE DISCOVERED LEAKING IN UNLOAD BY DESIGNATED RESPONDER. PACKAGE HAD NO EXTERIOR MARKINGS DESIGNATING THAT IT CONTAINED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL, UPON INSPECTION OF CONTENTS, 2 5 GAL JERRICANS WERE IDENTIFIED, ONE LABELED WITH CLASS 8 CORROSIVE LABEL DISCOVERED WITH NO MARKING ON THE OTHER. CONTAINER WITH CLASS 8 MARKING HELD AS UNDECLARED, THE OTHER JERRICAN WAS DISCOVERED TO HAVE LEAKED AND WAS PROCESSED VIA DMP.
